subject: Technology
title: The Forgotten Cosmonauts
description: A quick win: understand The Forgotten Cosmonauts.

hook.text: The Soviet space program had spectacular firsts. It also had tragic failures it tried to hide.

buildup.text: Vladimir Komarov knew his spacecraft, Soyuz 1, had over 200 design faults before launch.

discovery.text: He flew anyway because his backup was Yuri Gagarin, and he refused to let his friend die.

twist.text: The parachute failed on reentry. Komarov became the first person to die during a spaceflight in 1967.

climax.text: The Soviet Union classified many failures for decades. Only after its collapse did the full story emerge.

punchline.text: Komarov flew a doomed ship to save his friend's life.

quiz.question: Why did Vladimir Komarov fly Soyuz 1 despite knowing it was flawed?
options: He was ordered by the government
He wanted to protect his backup, Yuri Gagarin
He didn't know about the faults
